newsitem.title: DUBAI: Ten bays moved for construction at Dubai airport.
newsitem.headline: Ten bays moved for construction at Dubai airport.

text.p: Ten of the 23 aircraft parking bays at Dubai airport have been moved away from the main terminal to make way for a new building which is under construction.

"Construction work means that 10 out of 23 aircraft parking bays which were adjacent to the existing terminal are now located much further afield and airport vehicles often have to take circuitous routes to avoid construction work," a statement from the Emirates group said.
"This means that resources are being stretched to ensure on-time departure of aircraft and fast delivery of baggage."
Airport handler DNATA is part of the Emirates group.

The new terminal is due to be ready by December 1999, the statement said, and another terminal for charter operators and Commonwealth of Independent States flights will be opened at this year's Dubai airshow in November.

"Unfortunately, there are times when the sheer logistics of moving people and their baggage around work sites will cause delay," said Abdulla al-Ansari, acting director general of Dubai's Department of Civil Aviation.

"But we would ask that passengers bear with us for the interim and be assured that we are doing everything possible to lessen disruption during this temporary phase," he added. - Reuters Air Cargo Service Tel+ 44 171 542 7706 Fax +5017 - www.racs.com
